paper_metadata.title: Diagnosis and treatment of cardiac amyloidosis: an interdisciplinary consensus statement
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: 3-4% of African Americans, 10% of African Americans with heart failure with reduced ejection fraction (HFrEF)
patients.phenotype: primarily affects the neurological system (hereditary amyloid neuropathy, HAP)

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The Val50Met mutation mainly causes neurological changes (hereditary amyloid neuropathy, HAP).
The Val50Met mutation mainly causes neurological changes (hereditary amyloid neuropathy, HAP).

functional_data.summary: The Val50Met mutation is associated with hereditary amyloid neuropathy.

variants.additional_notes: The Val50Met mutation is one of the most studied variants in TTR amyloidosis.
key_quotes: A common mutation that specifically affects the heart is Val142Ile, which has been shown to be carried by 3–4% of African Americans.
